text: Solve this problem step by step.
End with 'DONE.' when you have a solution.
Question: A man lives on the 10th floor of an apartment building.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
When he returns in the evening, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and then walks up the stairs for the remaining three floors to his apartment.
However, on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.

Why does he do this? 

 Solution: 
<think>
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out why this man takes the elevator down every morning to the ground floor and then, in the evening, goes up to the 7th floor and walks up three more floors.
But on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.
Hmm, that's a bit puzzling.
Let me break it down.
First, he lives on the 10th floor.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor, which is the 1st floor.
I guess he's going to work.
In the evening, he returns and takes the elevator up to the 7th floor, then walks up three floors to his apartment.
So, why not just take the elevator all the way up in the evening? Maybe because the elevator isn't running, or it's too slow, or something else.
But then on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.
So, why the difference between rainy days and regular days? Maybe on rainy days, the elevator is faster or more convenient.
Or perhaps the stairs are slippery, so he doesn't want to walk up three floors when it's raining.
Wait, maybe it's about the time the elevator takes.
If the elevator is slow, maybe he saves time by getting off at the 7th floor and walking up.
But on rainy days, perhaps he doesn't mind waiting for the elevator to go all the way up because it's quicker than walking in the rain.
Or maybe the elevator is more reliable on rainy days, so he doesn't mind taking it all the way.
Alternatively, maybe the elevator only goes up to the 7th floor in the evening, and beyond that, he has to use the stairs.
So, on regular days, he takes the elevator up to 7 and walks up three.
On rainy days, maybe the elevator goes all the way to 10, or perhaps he doesn't mind taking the stairs in the rain, but he prefers the elevator on rainy days because it's faster or more comfortable.
I'm also thinking about the possibility that the elevator might not go beyond the 7th floor in the evening, so he has to walk up from there.
But on rainy days, maybe the elevator service is different, allowing it to go higher.
Or perhaps the man is in a hurry in the evening but not on rainy days.
Or maybe it's about the building's policies, like on rainy days, the elevator is more available or goes faster.
Wait, another angle: maybe on rainy days, the man doesn't want to get his shoes wet by walking up the stairs, so he takes the elevator all the way.
On regular days, he might prefer the exercise or it's quicker to walk up after the elevator stops at 7.
But why would the elevator stop at 7? Maybe the building has an elevator that goes up to 7, and beyond that, he has to walk.
So, in the evening, he takes the elevator to 7, then walks up three.
On rainy days, perhaps he doesn't mind taking the elevator all the way because it's faster, or maybe the elevator is more reliable when it's raining.
Alternatively, maybe the man works late sometimes and doesn't want to walk up in the dark or rain, so on those days, he takes the elevator all the way.
But the question says "on rainy days," so it's specifically about the weather.
I think the key is that on rainy days, he prefers not to walk up the stairs because it's slippery or uncomfortable, so he takes the elevator all the way.
On regular days, he might find it quicker to walk up after the elevator stops at 7.
Or perhaps the elevator is faster beyond the 7th floor on rainy days.
Maybe the elevator's speed changes, or it's more frequent when it's raining.
Wait, another thought: maybe the man lives on the 10th floor, but the elevator only goes up to the 7th floor in the evening.
So he has to walk up from there.
But on rainy days, the elevator might be available to go higher, so he takes it all the way.
Or maybe the elevator is out of order beyond the 7th floor on regular days, so he has to walk up, but on rainy days, it's working, so he takes it.
Alternatively, perhaps the man is in a hurry in the morning and takes the elevator all the way down, but in the evening, he's not in a hurry and prefers to take the elevator partway and walk up.
But that doesn't explain the rainy day behavior.
I think the main point is that on rainy days, he doesn't want to walk up the stairs because it's raining, so he takes the elevator all the way.
On regular days, he takes the elevator up to 7 and walks up the remaining three because it's quicker or he prefers it.
So the reason is that on rainy days, he avoids walking up the stairs because it's slippery or uncomfortable, hence he takes the elevator all the way.

</think>

The man takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor on rainy days because walking up the stairs would be slippery and uncomfortable.
On regular days, he takes the elevator up to the 7th floor and walks up the remaining three floors as it is quicker or he prefers it.
